nl: Let $p$ be an odd prime and let $1 + \frac{1}{2} + ... + \frac{1}{p - 1} = \frac{a}{b}$, where $a, b$ are integers. Show that $p \mid a$.
lean:
∀ {p : ℕ} (hp : Nat.Prime p) (hp1 : Odd p) :
  ∀ (a b : ℤ), (a / b : ℚ) = ∑ i in Finset.range (p-1), (1 / (i + 1), ℚ) → ↑p ∣ a
candidate: ∀ {p : ℕ} (hp_prime : Nat.Prime p) (hp_odd : p % 2 = 1) : ∃ a b : ℕ, (∑ i in Finset.range p, 1 / (i + 1, ℝ)) = a / b ∧ p ∣ a
